Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 13 of his 33 points in the fourth quarter to extend their lead from a single point to 17 in only five minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Rudy Gobert praised Anthony Edwards' steady improvement.

Anthony Edwards said, 'I don't want to be a team that's like been to the playoffs a couple times and then don't go back. Or been to the WCF and don't go back. I don't want to be that guy that had a moment.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Minnesota Timberwolves pulled out a comeback win over the Chicago Bulls in the Windy City, 135-119, thanks to a massive 45-24 fourth quarter.
Anthony Edwards has played his 69th career 30-point game, tying Lakers star Anthony Davis for 15th all time for players 23 years old and below.
The Timberwolves trading Karl-Anthony Towns for complementary players in the offseason signaled that Anthony Edwards now holds the keys to the team, and they'll go as far as he can take them.
Others: Rudy Gobert recorded 21 points and 9 rebounds.
Julius Randle scored 22 points and grabbed 10 rebounds.
